sections.title: What is an IMU?
sections.content:
An IMU (Inertial Measurement Unit) is a sensor that measures orientation, acceleration, and rotation. In FTC robots, IMUs are used for navigation, maintaining heading, and advanced autonomous routines.

For more, see gm0: IMU and REV Robotics: IMU.

sections.title: IMU Basics
sections.subtitle: Key characteristics:
items: Measures orientation (heading, pitch, roll)
Detects acceleration and rotation
Used for navigation and drive control
Requires calibration for accurate readings
Data accessed through hardwareMap in code

sections.title: How IMUs Work
sections.content: IMUs use gyroscopes and accelerometers to measure changes in orientation and movement. The sensor reports angles and acceleration values. See FTC Docs: IMU.

sections.title: IMU Initialization Example
Applications of IMUs
sections.content: IMUs are used for a variety of applications in FTC robots, including navigation, maintaining heading, and advanced autonomous routines. See gm0: IMU.

sections.title: Common Use Cases
items: Maintaining straight driving
Turning to specific angles
Detecting robot orientation
Stabilizing mechanisms
Advanced autonomous navigation

sections.title: IMU Safety and Best Practices
sections.content: Proper use of IMUs ensures reliable operation and accurate data. Always calibrate the IMU before use and avoid sudden impacts. See REV Robotics: Sensor Safety.

sections.title: Safety Guidelines
sections.subtitle: Follow these practices for safe IMU use:
items: Calibrate IMU before each match
Secure IMU to prevent movement during operation
Avoid exposing IMU to excessive vibration or impact
Monitor IMU data for unexpected values
Document IMU configuration and calibration

sections.title: IMU Safety Example
Troubleshooting IMUs
sections.content: Common IMU issues and their solutions help teams quickly resolve problems. See gm0: IMU Troubleshooting.

sections.title: Common Issues and Solutions
items: IMU not detected: Check wiring and configuration
Incorrect readings: Calibrate or check for interference
No response: Test with known movements and check code
Intermittent data: Secure connections and avoid loose wires
Unexpected values: Monitor for out-of-range or error codes

sections.title: IMU Practice
sections.description: Practice these exercises to master IMU use:
tasks: Create an OpMode that displays IMU data
Test IMU response to different movements
Calibrate IMU and document the process
Implement safety checks using IMU data
Test IMU integration with autonomous code
